definitions.definition: To be enough or sufficient ; to meet the need (of anything); to be adequate ; to be good enough.
examples: For this plum cake, two eggs should suffice .

definitions.definition: To satisfy ; to content ; to be equal to the wants or demands of.
examples: A joint of lamb sufficed even his enormous appetite.
During the festival, the temple suffices food to the beggars.
The king sufficed his army with food and weapons before the great battle.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To be enough or sufficient ; to meet the need (of anything); to be adequate ; to be good enough.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To satisfy ; to content ; to be equal to the wants or demands of.
( archaic ) To furnish ; to supply adequately.
